required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Placenta Accreta&Its Complications in Placenta Previa Cases
clinical_study.official_title: Incidence of Placenta Accreta & it's Complications in Cases of Previous Cesarean With Placenta Previa Anterior

brief_summary.textblock: Cases of previous cesarean with placenta previa anterior underwent cesarean section. Placenta accreta is diagnosed during cesarean section &confirmed by pathology. All complications are monitored in cases with placenta accreta and without.

detailed_description.textblock: 100 cases of gestational age 30 weeks or more with placenta previa anterior with previous one or more cesarean section will be enrolled. History,examination &routine investigations will be taken. Colour doppler will be done to diagnose cases with suspected placenta accreta. Pre & postoperative Hb concentration will be taken. Cases with nonseparation of the placenta will be diagnosed as accreta & confirmed by pathology. Operative time & complications like bladder or intestinal injury will be noted. All data will be analyzed.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of patients with placenta accreta.
Number of patients with bladder injury.
Number of patients with intestinal injury.
Number of patients with cesarean hysterectomy.

clinical_study.condition: Placenta Accreta in Placenta Previa Anterior

study_pop.textblock: Pregnant with gestational age more than 30 weeks with previous one or more cesarean section with placenta previa anterior

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- all pregnant women more than 30 weeks with previous one or more cesarean section with placenta previa anterior
Exclusion Criteria:
- pregnant with unscarred uterus
- scars other than cesarean section
